page.title: 04TRADITIONS/ARTS AND CRAFTS
page.content: Local customs and traditions have been passed down through the generations and are still going strong today.Despite the influence of oil related workers.The knitting, maybe{ {Fair Isle}or lace open work.{Fair Isle consists of patterns in coloured wool and the open work is very thin spidery lacey patterns.Spinning is not as widely used as it used to be.People sometimes do it to show tourists. Fishing is important and has been going on for centuries. The {Ness Yoal {is a special design of}boat used for fishing in the Sumburgh area.The Ness yoal is not used nowadays.Many people keep their boats in the {Virkie Pool. Many people are members of the Boating Club. Most of the fish caught eg.haddock whiting and flat fish are for eating. Most people in the Sumburgh own pets
